title: Revolutionizing Online Presence: How Scrunch AI Masters the New Era of AI Search
body: In a groundbreaking shift, the internet is evolving. As AI chatbots like ChatGPT become the go-to for information, businesses face a pivotal challenge: adapting their online presence for a world increasingly navigated by AI. Enter Scrunch AI, a pioneering platform designed to empower enterprises to not just exist, but excel in this new frontier of AI Search . Imagine a landscape where AI agents and crawlers become your primary website visitors – Scrunch AI is here to ensure you’re not just ready, but thriving. Navigating the AI Search Revolution: Why Traditional SEO Isn’t Enough The game has changed. Relying solely on traditional SEO tactics focused on human search queries is becoming increasingly inadequate. Here’s why: AI-Driven Information Retrieval: Users are increasingly turning to AI Chatbots for direct answers, bypassing traditional search engine results pages (SERPs). This means your website needs to be optimized for AI consumption, not just human browsing. Beyond Keywords: AI Web Crawlers analyze content contextually and semantically, going beyond simple keyword matching. Your website’s information architecture and content accuracy are now paramount. The Rise of AI Agents: As AI agents become more sophisticated, they will independently browse and assess websites on behalf of users. Your online presence needs to be agent-friendly to ensure accurate and favorable representation. This paradigm shift necessitates a new approach – one that Scrunch AI is expertly designed to address. Scrunch AI: Your Secret Weapon for Dominating AI Search Scrunch AI emerges as a vital tool for companies seeking to not just survive, but flourish in the age of AI Search . This innovative platform offers a suite of features designed to give businesses unprecedented control and visibility over their online presence in the AI-driven web. Key Benefits of Scrunch AI: AI Search Audit and Optimization: Scrunch AI meticulously audits your website, revealing exactly how AI Web Crawlers perceive your online information. It pinpoints areas for optimization to ensure accurate and favorable representation across various AI Search platforms. Real-time AI Search Visibility: Forget outdated reports. Scrunch AI provides updates every three days, giving you a dynamic view of how your information appears in AI Search results based on diverse customer prompts and demographics. Identify and Rectify Information Gaps: Uncover inaccuracies and outdated information that AI Chatbots might be sourcing from your website. Scrunch AI empowers you to proactively correct these issues, ensuring AI Search presents the most accurate and current picture of your business. Competitive Edge in Online Presence : Gain insights into how your competitors are represented in AI Search . Use this intelligence to refine your strategy and secure a leading position in the AI-driven information ecosystem. From Frustration to Innovation: The Genesis of Scrunch AI Chris Andrew, co-founder and CEO of Scrunch AI, experienced this shift in online behavior firsthand. As a former chief product officer at Hearsay Systems, Andrew noticed a personal change: “I realized I was visiting fewer websites. I was expecting an answer from ChatGPT instead of 20 links from Google.” This realization sparked an idea – if browsing itself is being outsourced to AI, the entire customer journey is poised for transformation. Validating this concept with CMOs, Andrew discovered a growing awareness of high-quality referral traffic originating from AI Search engines. However, a critical challenge emerged: inconsistent results for identical prompts across different AI Search platforms. This inconsistency highlighted a fundamental truth: a company’s online narrative is no longer solely self-defined. It’s a blend of self-presentation, third-party information, and competitive positioning – a complex equation demanding constant monitoring and strategic management. Scrunch AI’s Journey: From Startup to Funding Success Launched in Fall 2023 by Andrew and co-founder Robert MacCloy, Scrunch AI quickly transitioned from concept to reality, launching its product in November 2024. The platform’s value proposition resonated strongly, attracting 25 enterprise clients, including industry giants like Lenovo and BairesDev, alongside institutions like Penn State University. This early traction fueled a successful $4 million seed round led by Mayfield, with notable angel investors including Clara Shih, TJ Parker, and Bryant Chou. This funding injection will propel Scrunch AI’s product development, further solidifying its position as a leader in the AI Search optimization space. Standing Out in a Growing Market: The Scrunch AI Advantage While Scrunch AI isn’t alone in recognizing the burgeoning need for AI Search optimization, its unique approach sets it apart. Competitors like Profound focus on SEO monitoring dashboards, and traditional agencies are starting to offer AI Search services. However, Scrunch AI distinguishes itself by: Customer Journey Focus: Scrunch AI goes beyond surface-level search result monitoring. It delves into the entire customer journey as perceived by AI agents, providing a holistic view of online presence . Agent-Centric Approach: Scrunch AI prioritizes optimization not just for human-AI interactions but, crucially, for AI-to-website interactions. This forward-thinking strategy anticipates a future where AI agents are primary web navigators. Andrew emphasizes this agent-centric vision: “I think people were like, ‘How do we use AI to make our website better?’ And my mindset was like, ‘Your website’s going to need to be for an agent or crawler in the future.’” This foresight is resonating with enterprise clients who recognize that brand perception is increasingly shaped by AI Chatbots like ChatGPT, Gemini, Siri, and Google AI Overviews. Embrace the AI Search Future with Scrunch AI The rise of AI Search is not just a trend; it’s a fundamental shift in how information is accessed and consumed online. For businesses, adapting to this change is no longer optional – it’s essential for maintaining and enhancing their online presence . Scrunch AI provides the tools and insights necessary to navigate this new landscape, ensuring your company not only appears in AI Search results but shines. By focusing on optimizing for AI Web Crawlers and understanding the AI-driven customer journey, Scrunch AI empowers businesses to take control of their narrative in the age of intelligent search. To learn more about the latest AI market trends, explore our article on key developments shaping AI features.

title: Can Ethereum Price Sink To $1,000 After Drop Below $2000
body: Ethereum price briefly dipped under $2,000 for the first time in over a year as on-chain data points to a gloomy future. Pundits say Ethereum could be on a death march toward $1,000 in a steep decline that has left speculators scratching their heads. Ethereum Price Could Be Headed To $1,000 Ethereum (ETH) woes appear to be worsening following a dip in prices below $2,000 since December 2023. Ethereum price touched $1,996 before staging a valiant climb back to $2,135, triggering concerns over its future direction. On-chain data is grim for the largest altcoin with several indicators pointing toward a downward trend. Ethereum’s weekly RSI is at its lowest ebb for the first time since 2022 at 35.84. Similar RSI levels in 2022 saw the asset price fall even further by a staggering -60%. Analysts say that the Ethereum price could fall to $1,000 given similar market conditions in 2022. The slip below $2000 follows an earlier dip below $2,200, leaving its parallel channel which experts say could induce correction to $1,600. Ethereum’s triple-top pattern in its weekly chart is indicative of a 60% decline as bears have a field day. A 60% decline at current levels will see Ethereum price dip below the $1,000 mark. Ethereum Is On Course To Record Its Worst Q1 The largest altcoin has endured a wave of negative sentiments since the start of 2025. Ethereum price has fallen by nearly 40% from its high of $3,300 at the start of the year. A drop to $1,600 will see Ethereum record its worst Q1 performance , dwarfing the lows of the first quarter of 2024. US Ethereum ETFs recorded massive outflows while ETHA share price shed 38.59% since the start of the year. While institutional interest around ETH sinks, the asset’s proposed inclusion into the US Crypto Strategic Reserve did little to stave off the massive decline. Despite the grim outlook, some pundits say the decline presents a buying opportunity for long-term investors. “We are going into the undervaluation zone,” said the pseudonymous Venturefounder on X (formerly Twitter). The post Can Ethereum Price Sink To $1,000 After Drop Below $2000 appeared first on CoinGape .

title: ‘Shield crypto from federal overreach’: Winklevoss twin says
body: Cameron Winklevoss, co-founder of crypto exchange Gemini, has urged lawmakers to enact crypto regulations that protect the industry from federal overreach. In a March 4 statement on X, Winklevoss claimed that regulatory enforcement actions have been weaponized to stifle crypto innovation. He argued that agencies are being used against digital assets for political purposes, calling for legal protections to prevent politically motivated enforcement actions. Any future crypto legislation must make it very hard to weaponize federal agencies against crypto. Crypto needs rules, not because investors lack protection but because builders and companies lack protection — we need a firewall against federal regulatory attacks. This should be… — Cameron Winklevoss (@cameron) March 4, 2025 Winklevoss criticized Senator Elizabeth Warren, alleging that she has influenced the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission to undermine the crypto sector through excessive enforcement actions. He warned that Warren could extend similar influence over the Commodity Futures Trading Commission and other financial watchdogs in the future. He expressed concerns that agencies such as the SEC and CFTC could be leveraged by political figures to push an anti-crypto agenda. Drawing parallels with Warren’s past actions against banks and fintech companies, he emphasized the need for a “zero trust model” in dealing with regulators. Senator Elizabeth Warren’s previous anti-crypto actions , including her most recent scrutiny of Tether’s banking relationships with President Donald Trump’s nominee for Commerce Secretary, Howard Lutnick, are indicative of a broader pattern that could extend to other financial regulatory bodies, Winklevoss fears. You might also like: Mexican Billionaire Ricardo Salinas allocates 70% of his portfolio to Bitcoin Concerns over regulatory influence and enforcement bias Winklevoss also voiced distrust toward financial regulators, claiming that anti-crypto policymakers have infiltrated regulatory agencies and are using their power to push political agendas rather than ensure fair oversight. He specifically referenced SEC Chair Gary Gensler, who previously served as CFTC chairman from 2009 to 2014, suggesting that regulatory agencies could be influenced by political ideologies, posing risks to crypto entrepreneurs and businesses. This perspective aligns with broader industry sentiments regarding regulatory scrutiny. For instance, the SEC’s recent decision to drop its case against Gemini and a host of other crypto platforms was seen as a positive development by Winklevoss, who has previously criticized regulatory actions against crypto platforms. Additionally, Gemini’s recent achievement of securing in-principle approval for an Investment Firm License in Malta signifies the company’s commitment to complying with international regulatory standards, further emphasizing the importance of clear and fair regulations. Moreover, Winklevoss’s stance mirrors the crypto industry’s broader concerns about potential “debanking” practices targeting crypto-related businesses. title: Exclusive: OpenAI’s $50M Grant Ignites Academic AI Research Revolution
body: In a bold move to propel the future of artificial intelligence, OpenAI has launched a game-changing $50 million grant program, NextGenAI, specifically designed to empower academic research. This initiative promises to inject vital resources into top universities, fostering groundbreaking discoveries and nurturing the next generation of AI pioneers. For the crypto-savvy audience, this surge in AI development signals potentially transformative impacts on blockchain technology and decentralized applications. Let’s delve into how OpenAI Grants are set to reshape the landscape of AI research funding . What is the NextGenAI Program and Why Does it Matter? The NextGenAI Program is not just another grant; it’s a strategic consortium spearheaded by OpenAI, uniting 15 prestigious academic institutions including Harvard, MIT, and the University of Oxford. This initiative is structured around three core pillars: Substantial Financial Grants: $50 million in research grants will directly fund innovative AI projects within universities. Compute Power: Access to OpenAI’s cutting-edge computational resources, crucial for complex AI model training and experimentation. API Access: Seamless integration with OpenAI’s advanced AI APIs, allowing researchers to leverage state-of-the-art tools in their work. OpenAI emphasizes that NextGenAI Program is about more than just funding. It’s about cultivating a future-ready workforce and accelerating the pace of AI innovation. As they stated in their blog post, this initiative is designed to support researchers seeking cures, scholars uncovering insights, and students mastering AI for tomorrow’s challenges. Boosting Academic AI Research: Who Benefits? The beneficiaries of these OpenAI Grants are diverse, encompassing: Students: Providing opportunities to engage in cutting-edge AI research, enhancing their skills and career prospects in a rapidly evolving field. Educators: Empowering faculty to integrate advanced AI tools and research into their curricula, enriching the learning experience. Researchers: Offering crucial financial and computational resources to conduct ambitious AI projects that might otherwise be constrained by funding limitations. This injection of resources is particularly timely. With recent reports of potential setbacks in government-led AI research funding within the U.S., NextGenAI steps in to potentially bridge critical gaps and ensure the continued progress of vital AI work. Navigating the Nuances: Is OpenAI a Neutral Player? While the NextGenAI Program is undoubtedly a significant boost for academic AI research , it’s essential to consider OpenAI’s position in the AI ecosystem. As a leading AI company, OpenAI naturally benefits from wider adoption of its technologies. The program could be viewed as a strategic move to: Aspect Potential Benefit for OpenAI Ecosystem Expansion Encourages researchers and students to become deeply familiar with OpenAI’s tools and platforms. Talent Pipeline Cultivates a pool of AI talent proficient in OpenAI technologies, potentially leading to future hires or collaborations. Market Influence Positions OpenAI as a key enabler of academic AI advancement, strengthening its industry leadership. This isn’t inherently negative, but it’s a factor to consider. While University AI Funding from diverse sources is ideal, OpenAI’s initiative offers substantial and immediate support at a critical juncture. Researchers should remain mindful of the broader AI landscape, including open-source alternatives, to ensure a balanced approach to AI development. Actionable Insights: What Does This Mean for the Future of AI and Crypto? The launch of NextGenAI has several key implications: Accelerated AI Innovation: Increased funding and resources will likely lead to faster breakthroughs in various AI fields. Talent Development: The program will nurture a new generation of AI experts, crucial for the continued growth of the AI industry. Cross-Disciplinary Impact: Advancements in AI can have profound effects on other sectors, including cryptocurrency and blockchain, potentially leading to more sophisticated and secure decentralized technologies. For the cryptocurrency world, advancements in AI could mean enhanced security protocols for blockchains, more efficient cryptocurrency trading algorithms, and innovative decentralized AI applications. The synergy between AI and blockchain is a space ripe with potential, and initiatives like NextGenAI can act as a catalyst for this convergence. Conclusion: A Powerful Leap Forward for AI Research OpenAI’s $50 million NextGenAI Program is a momentous step towards bolstering academic AI research . By providing significant AI research funding , computational resources, and API access to top universities, OpenAI is investing in the very foundation of future AI innovation. While it’s important to acknowledge OpenAI’s strategic interests, the immediate impact of this initiative on accelerating research and nurturing talent is undeniable. This program promises to be a significant force in shaping the trajectory of AI, with ripple effects extending across industries, including the dynamic world of cryptocurrency. title: IMF Loan Restricts El Salvador's Bitcoin Policies, Targets 3.5% GDP Improvement
body: El Salvador has secured a 40-month, $1.4 billion Extended Fund Facility (EFF) from the International Monetary Fund (IMF), which imposes restrictions on the country's Bitcoin policies. The IMF deal prohibits voluntary Bitcoin accumulation by the public sector, mandates the liquidation of the Fidebitcoin Trust, and requires disclosure of government-held Bitcoin wallet addresses and holdings. The agreement includes measures to end public participation in the Chivo wallet by July 2025 and to establish a management framework for government-held Bitcoin. The Bitcoin Law has also been amended, making Bitcoin acceptance voluntary for private entities. The IMF described Bitcoin usage in the country as existing in a 'confined' manner, with negligible tax payments and limited public trust due to high price volatility. Despite these restrictions, El Salvador recently purchased an additional 5 Bitcoin, bringing its total holdings to 6,100 BTC, valued at approximately $600 million. The EFF arrangement aims for a 3.5% GDP primary balance improvement over three years. To continue reading this as well as other DeFi and Web3 news, visit us at thedefiant.io

title: Bybit Demands Swap Fee Refund From ParaSwap to Recoup Hacked Funds
body: Bybit, a prominent crypto exchange, asks the ParaSwap DAO protocol to return over $90,000 in Ethereum (ETH) that a hacker paid as swap fees. This request has caused a big debate in the decentralized finance (DeFi). Some people think ParaSwap should return the money, while others say it is not responsible for the hacker’s actions. If the DAO agrees, it could set a legal precedent that may change how DeFi platforms handle stolen funds. A Tough Choice for ParaSwap DAO Bybit believes that since the money came from a hacker, it should be returned. The stolen funds were part of the $1.46 billion theft linked to Lazarus Group , the allegedly North Korea-backed hackers. However, the matter is complicated. ParaSwap DAO earned the fees through smart contracts, which means the transactions were technically legitimate. If the protocol agrees to return the funds, it could set a risky precedent. Other exchanges might start demanding refunds in similar cases, raising concerns about how DAOs handle such situations in the future. Some in the DeFi community argue that “code is law.” This means transactions executed on-chain should remain final, even if they involve stolen funds. Can Bybit And PanSwap Meet In A Middle Ground? Some people think ParaSwap DAO should not return all the money. Instead, they suggest keeping 10% and giving back the rest as a goodwill gesture. This could help Bybit regain some of its lost funds while protecting DAOs from being forced to return swap fees in future hacks. In a statement, Bybit’s CEO, Ben Zhou, said most of the stolen money is nearly untraceable . This came after the Federal Bureau of Investigation (FBI) reported that the attackers sent the funds to many blockchain addresses, making it hard to track and recover. This was one of the biggest crypto hacks ever, and Bybit is still struggling to recover its losses. All Eyes on ParaSwap ParaSwap’s decision could have long-lasting effects on the DeFi sector. If it returns the crypto fees, more people might ask for refunds in the future. It shows that smart contract transactions cannot be changed if they refuse. This debate shows how hard it is to balance security, fairness, and decentralization in crypto. The post Bybit Demands Swap Fee Refund From ParaSwap to Recoup Hacked Funds appeared first on TheCoinrise.com .

title: BankPozitif Partners with Taurus to Expand Crypto Services in Turkey
body: A Benchmark for Turkey’s Digital Asset Industry Turkey’s leading digital bank, BankPozitif, has partnered with Swiss digital asset infrastructure company Taurus to offer institutional-grade cryptocurrency custody solutions. The partnership reinforces BankPozitif’s leadership in Turkey’s emerging fintech sector. Through this partnership, BankPozitif will integrate Taurus-PROTECT , a custody solution with safe support for cryptocurrencies, tokenized assets, and digital currencies. Additionally, it will deploy Taurus-EXPLORER , a blockchain node and indexing solution offering access to multiple blockchain networks. “Where we’re relying on new products and digitalization, this partnership with Taurus represents a fresh advance,” said Dr. Erkan Kork, Chairman at BankPozitif. “The Turkish banking sector size has grown to 30 trillion liras, and institutional demand for digital asset service keeps increasing.” Taurus Expands Global Reach Taurus has been rampantly expanding its footprint, recently collaborating with Chainlink Labs to accelerate tokenized asset adoption. The collaboration introduced Chainlink Data Feeds for real-time asset data and Proof of Reserve for greater transparency to address security and cross-chain connectivity challenges. Having existing partnerships like Deutsche Bank and State Street, Taurus looks at Turkey as a strategic market. “High adoption rates, growing institutional demand, and favorable regulatory conditions make Türkiye an exciting place for digital asset banking,” said Lamine Brahimi, Managing Partner at Taurus. Growing Crypto Adoption in Turkey Turkey also witnessed a boom in cryptocurrency adoption due to economic conditions and concerns regarding inflation. As regulatory structures change, the alliance of BankPozitif and Taurus sees a more widespread trend of legacy banks incorporating digital asset services to address market demand. Apart from fortifying Turkey’s digital banking environment, the alliance also indicates growing institutional confidence in Turkey’s crypto market.

title: Future Of Bitcoin: Michael Saylor Envisions Market Cap Climbing To $200 Trillion
body: In a recent interview with CNBC, Michael Saylor, co-founder of Strategy, reiterated his bullish outlook on Bitcoin (BTC), predicting the cryptocurrency could reach a staggering $200 trillion market cap. Saylor Forecasts $10 Million Per Bitcoin Currently valued at about $2 trillion, Saylor believes Bitcoin’s trajectory will see it grow to $20 trillion and eventually hit the $200 trillion mark, translating to an approximate price of $10 million per BTC based on its capped supply of 21 million coins. Saylor attributes this potential growth to a global shift in capital investment, stating, “That capital is coming from overseas… from China, from Russia, from Europe, from Africa, from Asia, from the 20th century to the 21st century.” Related Reading: Ethereum Price Breaks Out—10% Surge Sparks Bullish Momentum His forecast comes against the backdrop of President Donald Trump’s recent announcement regarding the creation of a Crypto Strategic Reserve, which would include BTC alongside Ethereum (ETH), XRP, Solana (SOL), and Cardano (ADA), which ignited a heated debate within financial and crypto circles. While Saylor acknowledges the appeal of a Bitcoin-only reserve, he supports Trump’s broader strategy that encompasses multiple cryptocurrencies. He emphasized, “There’s no way to interpret this other than this is bullish for Bitcoin and is bullish for the entire US crypto industry.” Although some conservatives, such as Coinbase CEO Brian Armstrong and Gemini co-founder Tyler Winklevoss, have advocated for more restrictive, Bitcoin-centric policies, Saylor noted that the president’s approach allows for a more inclusive economic policy. Saylor Dismisses Volatility Concerns When asked about his involvement with the White House, Saylor confirmed he has been in discussions with various lawmakers, both Democratic and Republican, as well as members of the Cabinet and administration. “For the last four and a half years, I’ve been talking about Bitcoin to anybody, anywhere in the world, every day,” Michael Saylor stated during his interview, highlighting his commitment to promoting the cryptocurrency. Saylor argues that establishing a strategic Bitcoin reserve could provide the United States with significant economic advantages, including the potential to alleviate the national debt. Saylor posits, “If the United States takes a position in the emerging crypto economy, if it buys up 10, 20% of the Bitcoin network, we’re going to pay off the national debt. And so why wouldn’t that be in the interest of the United States?” Related Reading: Dogecoin Will Start A Move To $4 If Current Demand Holds – Can Bulls Step In? Addressing concerns about Bitcoin’s notorious volatility, Saylor pointed to its historical long-term gains, asserting, “I don’t think anybody’s ever lost money in the Bitcoin network holding for four years. Presumably, you want to buy Bitcoin, you want to hold it for 100 years.” The proposal for a US Crypto Reserve is still in its infancy, and Saylor indicated that its success will depend heavily on legislative decisions made in the coming months. “There are a dozen people on it: the head of the Treasury, the SEC, the CFTC, Commerce, the Attorney General, the President… both the Republicans and the Democrats,” he noted, emphasizing the diverse range of opinions that will influence the outcome. At the time of writing, BTC has found support at around $83,869 after posting losses of 7% and 6% over the past 24 hours and seven days, respectively. Featured image from DALL-E, chart from TradingView.com

title: Shocking Crypto Divestment: David Sacks Unloads Multicoin Stake Amid Reserve Plan Firestorm
body: In a surprising turn of events in the crypto and political sphere, tech entrepreneur and prominent figure in both AI and crypto policy, David Sacks, has publicly disclosed his prior divestment from crypto investment firm Multicoin Capital. This revelation came through a post on X (formerly Twitter), adding fuel to an already heated debate surrounding cryptocurrency and political influence. But what exactly prompted this disclosure, and what does it mean for the ongoing discussions about crypto regulation and potential conflicts of interest? David Sacks Crypto Divestment: The X Disclosure The saga unfolded on social media when American political commentator Krystal Ball directed a pointed query towards David Sacks on X. Ball’s criticism centered around concerns about a proposed crypto reserve plan involving President Donald Trump, alleging it could be a scheme to divert taxpayer funds for personal gain. She labeled it a potential “world historic heist,” a strong accusation that caught the attention of many. In response to this direct criticism, Sacks took to X to defend himself and clarify his financial positions. In a move that surprised some in the crypto community, he disclosed that he had already sold his investment in Multicoin Capital. This shocking disclosure was intended to counter any implications that he might be personally profiting from current crypto market dynamics or any potential future crypto reserve initiatives. Sacks specifically mentioned selling his shares in BITW, the Bitwise 10 Crypto Index Fund, on January 22nd, for a total of $74,000. This detail was crucial to his defense, as it directly addressed the accusations of personal financial gain and aimed to demonstrate transparency regarding his crypto-related investments. [img src=”image-placeholder.jpg” alt=”David Sacks Crypto Divestment”] David Sacks’ X disclosure regarding his crypto investments sparked a significant debate. Multicoin Capital Investment: What Was Sold? To fully grasp the significance of David Sacks’ disclosure, it’s important to understand what Multicoin Capital is and what BITW represents. Multicoin Capital is a well-known investment firm that focuses exclusively on the crypto space. They invest in a variety of crypto assets and blockchain-related companies, making them a significant player in the digital asset ecosystem. An investment from Multicoin Capital is often seen as a strong endorsement within the crypto industry. BITW, or the Bitwise 10 Crypto Index Fund, is a passively managed exchange-traded fund (ETF) designed to track the performance of the top ten cryptocurrencies by market capitalization. It provides investors with diversified exposure to the leading digital assets, including Bitcoin and Ethereum. Selling shares in BITW effectively means divesting from a broad basket of leading cryptocurrencies, reflecting a significant move away from direct crypto market exposure at that time. Here’s a quick look at what BITW represents: Diversification: Exposure to the top 10 cryptocurrencies. Accessibility: Traded on traditional stock exchanges, making crypto investment accessible to a wider audience. Passive Management: Tracks an index, reducing the need for active trading decisions. Crypto Controversy and Krystal Ball’s Criticism The backdrop to this crypto controversy is the ongoing debate about the role of cryptocurrency in the financial system and the potential for government involvement. Krystal Ball’s criticism wasn’t just directed at David Sacks, but also at the broader idea of a “crypto reserve” being proposed in political circles. Her “heist” accusation highlights a deep-seated skepticism about the motives behind such initiatives, particularly when prominent figures with crypto investments are involved. Ball’s concerns touch upon several critical points: Taxpayer Money: The idea of using taxpayer money to fund a crypto reserve raises questions about public resource allocation. Potential Conflicts of Interest: Individuals with significant crypto holdings potentially benefiting from policy changes. Transparency and Accountability: The need for clear oversight and accountability in any government-related crypto initiatives. While Sacks’ disclosure of his crypto divestment aims to address conflict-of-interest concerns, the broader debate about crypto policy and regulation remains very much alive. BITW Investment and the Timing of the Sale The timing of David Sacks’ BITW investment sale – January 22nd – is noteworthy. While the specific reasons for his divestment at that particular date are not explicitly stated, it raises questions about market conditions and his investment strategy at the time. January 2022 was a period of volatility in the crypto markets, with Bitcoin and other cryptocurrencies experiencing significant price swings. Selling BITW shares at $74,000 suggests a strategic decision was made amidst this market uncertainty. Whether it was driven by risk aversion, portfolio rebalancing, or other factors, the timing adds another layer of intrigue to the disclosure. Understanding the context of the market conditions around January 2022 can provide further insights into the rationale behind this BITW investment decision. Here’s a simplified timeline: Date Event Significance January 22nd David Sacks sells BITW shares Divestment from crypto market index fund Recent Krystal Ball criticizes crypto reserve plan Triggers Sacks’ disclosure Ongoing Debate about crypto policy and regulation Broader context for the disclosure Crypto Reserve Plan: The Bigger Picture The controversy surrounding David Sacks’ crypto reserve plan disclosure is intertwined with larger discussions about the future of cryptocurrency regulation and adoption. The idea of a national crypto reserve, while still vague in its details, sparks significant debate within the crypto community and beyond. Proponents argue it could foster innovation and position the US as a leader in the digital asset space. Critics, like Krystal Ball, express concerns about potential misuse of funds and undue influence from crypto industry insiders. Key questions surrounding the crypto reserve plan include: Purpose: What would be the specific objectives of a crypto reserve? Funding: How would such a reserve be funded, and what safeguards would be in place? Governance: Who would manage and oversee the crypto reserve? Impact: What would be the broader economic and societal impacts of such a plan? David Sacks’ disclosure, while focused on his personal investments, highlights the complexities and sensitivities surrounding crypto policy at the intersection of finance, technology, and politics. It serves as a reminder of the ongoing scrutiny and the need for transparency as the crypto industry continues to evolve and seek greater integration with mainstream financial and political systems. Conclusion: Transparency in the Crypto Age David Sacks’ public disclosure of his Multicoin Capital investment divestment is a significant event in the ongoing crypto narrative. While it was prompted by criticism and aimed to defend his position, it also underscores the growing importance of transparency and accountability in the crypto space, particularly for individuals operating at the intersection of technology, finance, and public policy. As the debate about crypto regulation and initiatives like crypto reserves intensifies, openness and clear communication will be crucial for building trust and fostering constructive dialogue. To learn more about the latest crypto market trends, explore our article on key developments shaping Bitcoin price action.

title: Revolutionary Story Protocol & Oxford University Alliance to Unlock Future of AI Research
body: In an exciting development at the intersection of blockchain and artificial intelligence, Story Protocol, the innovative project building a blockchain-based open IP infrastructure, has announced a groundbreaking partnership with the prestigious Oxford University. This collaboration is set to propel forward the frontiers of AI research , specifically focusing on enhancing the way AI agents communicate and negotiate. Why is this Collaboration between Story Protocol and Oxford University Significant for AI Research? This isn’t just another partnership; it’s a strategic alliance that brings together the cutting-edge technology of Story Protocol with the academic rigor and research prowess of Oxford University. But what makes this collaboration truly noteworthy? Let’s break it down: Synergy of Expertise: Oxford University , a global leader in AI research, brings its deep understanding of complex AI systems and agent behavior. Story Protocol contributes its expertise in blockchain technology and decentralized infrastructure, creating a powerful synergy. Focus on AI Agent Communication: The core of this research lies in improving how AI agents interact. Think about it – for AI to truly become integrated into our lives, agents need to communicate effectively, negotiate terms, and understand each other clearly. This research directly addresses these crucial aspects. Development of Agent TCP/IP Framework: Imagine a world where AI agents from different platforms can seamlessly interact, much like computers on the internet using TCP/IP. This initiative aims to develop the ‘Agent TCP/IP framework’, a standardized protocol to ensure interoperability among AI agents. Real-World Impact: The findings from this research aren’t just theoretical. They are intended to be practically applied, contributing to the development of more robust, efficient, and interoperable AI systems in the future. What is Story Protocol and its Role in Blockchain IP? For those new to the space, Story Protocol is pioneering a fascinating concept: open IP infrastructure on the blockchain. In simpler terms, they are building a system that allows creators to manage, control, and monetize their intellectual property (IP) in a decentralized and transparent manner. Think of it as a new paradigm for digital ownership and creativity. Here’s why blockchain is a game-changer for IP: Let’s elaborate on these benefits in a more detailed manner: Benefit Description Impact on Creators Transparency & Provenance Blockchain provides an immutable record of IP creation and ownership. Every transaction and modification is recorded on a public ledger, ensuring transparency. Creators can definitively prove ownership and track the history of their IP, reducing disputes and enhancing trust. Decentralized Control Unlike traditional IP systems, blockchain allows creators to maintain greater control over their IP without relying on central authorities. Creators gain autonomy in managing and distributing their IP, fostering innovation and reducing reliance on intermediaries. Efficient Monetization Smart contracts on the blockchain can automate IP licensing and royalty payments, making monetization more efficient and reducing transaction costs. Creators can directly monetize their IP and receive royalties transparently and efficiently, opening up new revenue streams. Global Accessibility Blockchain is inherently global, making IP management and licensing accessible across borders without complex legal frameworks. Creators can easily manage and monetize their IP on a global scale, reaching wider audiences and markets. Enhanced Security Blockchain’s cryptographic security protects IP from unauthorized access, tampering, and infringement. Creators benefit from robust security measures to safeguard their IP assets, reducing the risk of piracy and unauthorized use. How Will Oxford University’s Expertise Enhance AI Agent Negotiation? Oxford University’s involvement is critical to the success of this initiative. Their researchers are at the forefront of AI, particularly in areas like multi-agent systems, negotiation strategies, and natural language processing. Here’s how their expertise will be instrumental: Advanced Negotiation Algorithms: Oxford’s AI experts will contribute to developing sophisticated algorithms that enable AI agents to negotiate effectively. This includes strategies for reaching agreements, resolving conflicts, and optimizing outcomes in various scenarios. Improved Communication Clarity: Miscommunication can be a major hurdle in AI agent interactions. The research will focus on enhancing communication clarity, ensuring that agents understand each other’s intentions and messages accurately, reducing ambiguity and errors. Ethical and Social Implications: As AI agents become more sophisticated, ethical considerations are paramount. Oxford’s researchers will also explore the ethical and social implications of AI agent interactions, ensuring responsible development and deployment. Rigorous Testing and Validation: Oxford University’s academic environment provides a robust platform for rigorous testing and validation of the Agent TCP/IP framework. This ensures that the framework is not only theoretically sound but also practically effective. What are the Potential Benefits of the Agent TCP/IP Framework? The Agent TCP/IP framework is the tangible outcome of this research, and it holds immense potential for the future of AI. Imagine a future where AI agents can seamlessly collaborate across different platforms and applications. The benefits are far-reaching: Enhanced AI Interoperability: The primary benefit is improved interoperability. Just as TCP/IP allowed computers worldwide to connect, Agent TCP/IP will enable AI agents from different developers and platforms to communicate and work together. Accelerated AI Innovation: By providing a common communication standard, the framework can significantly accelerate AI innovation. Developers can focus on building specialized AI agents knowing they can easily integrate with other systems. New Applications and Use Cases: Interoperable AI agents can unlock a plethora of new applications. From smart cities to decentralized autonomous organizations (DAOs), the possibilities are vast. Imagine AI agents coordinating traffic flow in a city, or managing complex supply chains across different organizations. Reduced Development Costs: Standardization reduces the need for custom integration solutions. Developers can save time and resources, leading to more cost-effective AI development. Foster Collaboration in AI Ecosystem: A shared framework promotes collaboration within the AI ecosystem. It encourages open innovation and the development of more powerful and versatile AI solutions. What Challenges Might Arise in this AI and Blockchain Collaboration? While the potential is immense, it’s important to acknowledge the challenges that may arise in this ambitious collaboration: Complexity of AI Agent Communication: Developing a universal communication protocol for AI agents is inherently complex. AI agents vary greatly in their design, capabilities, and communication styles. Creating a framework that accommodates this diversity is a significant technical challenge. Ensuring Security and Privacy: As AI agents communicate and exchange data, ensuring security and privacy is crucial. The framework must incorporate robust security measures to protect against malicious actors and data breaches. Adoption and Standardization: Even with a technically sound framework, widespread adoption is not guaranteed. Convincing different AI developers and organizations to adopt the Agent TCP/IP framework will require significant effort and collaboration across the industry. Ethical and Governance Frameworks: Interoperable AI agents raise complex ethical and governance questions. Who is responsible when agents from different systems interact and potentially cause harm? Establishing clear ethical guidelines and governance frameworks is essential. Balancing Innovation and Standardization: Standardization can sometimes stifle innovation. The challenge will be to create a framework that provides a common foundation while still allowing for innovation and differentiation in AI agent development. Actionable Insights: What Does This Mean for the Future? This collaboration between Story Protocol and Oxford University is more than just an academic exercise; it’s a forward-looking initiative that could reshape the future of AI and blockchain. Here are some actionable insights to consider: For Developers: Keep an eye on the development of the Agent TCP/IP framework. It could become a crucial standard for building interoperable AI applications in the future. Understanding and potentially contributing to this framework could be highly beneficial. For Businesses: Consider the implications of interoperable AI agents for your industry. How could seamless AI communication transform your operations, create new efficiencies, or unlock new business models? Start exploring potential use cases. For Researchers: This collaboration opens up exciting research avenues in AI, blockchain, and decentralized systems. There are opportunities to contribute to the development of the Agent TCP/IP framework and explore its applications. For Investors: The intersection of blockchain and AI is a rapidly growing space. Projects like Story Protocol, which are building infrastructure for this convergence, are worth watching closely. The success of initiatives like Agent TCP/IP could drive significant value creation. Conclusion: A Revolutionary Step Towards Interoperable AI The partnership between Story Protocol and Oxford University marks a revolutionary step towards a future where AI agents can communicate and collaborate seamlessly. By focusing on enhancing AI agent negotiation and developing the Agent TCP/IP framework, this initiative has the potential to unlock unprecedented levels of AI interoperability and innovation. title: Why is Ripple’s XRP SEC case still ongoing amid the dismissal spree?
body: Ripple Labs and the US Securities and Exchange Commission, a court battle that has gone on for more than four years now. We can argue that since 2020, there’s never been a moment in time that the XRP community has felt the case will come to a close more than this year. But why hasn’t the lawsuit been dismissed, yet other institutions like Coinbase, Kraken, and OpenSea are in the clear? Here’s why. Since US President Donald Trump made his official comeback to the White House, the SEC has been slowly walking away from its aggressive enforcement approach toward the cryptocurrency industry, which was seen under the Biden administration, led by former chair the infamous Gary Gensler. Former SEC Chair Gary Gensler. Photographer: Andrew Harrer/Bloomberg The agency pursued several lawsuits against major crypto firms like Ripple Labs, Binance, Coinbase, and Kraken, claiming these platforms violated securities laws. But there could be light at the end of the pitch-black tunnel; the Trump administration loves crypto. Commissioner Hester Peirce, who now leads the SEC’s Crypto Task Force, recently issued a statement that criticized the previous administration’s reliance on “regulation by enforcement.” She reckoned that “blurry regulatory laws” harmed the American public, stifled the growth of the crypto industry, and “impeded the ability of the Commission’s skilled and dedicated professional staff” to exhaust their expertise in finding a common ground where everyone is satisfied. Still, even though several cases have been thrown out the window, Ripple is still looking for a way to escape the clutch of the financial regulator. And just like members of the XRP family, we are all waiting for the SEC to give us a clear reason why. The SEC vs Ripple: Four years and counting The SEC’s lawsuit against Ripple, filed in December 2020, alleges that the company illegally raised funds through XRP sales without registering the asset as a security. It also accuses Ripple executives Brad Garlinghouse and Chris Larsen of personally profiting from unregistered XRP sales, amounting to $600 million. The financial watchdog also propounded that Ripple distributed billions of XRP in exchange for services, further violating securities laws. Injunctive relief, disgorgement of profits with interest, civil penalties, failure to provide investor disclosures; to say the SEC fired at Ripple on all fronts is an understatement. In 2023, however, the road became a little clearer when US District Judge Analisa Torres ruled in favor of Ripple, stating that blind bid-ask sales of XRP did not constitute securities transactions. But the SEC did not want to let this go without a word, as in one of its final actions under Gary Gensler, the agency appealed the ruling on January 15, 2025. Why is the SEC quiet on Ripple? The US financial watchdog has dismissed several cases in recent weeks, some crypto advocates are speaking of an internal resistance within the agency preventing the conclusion of Ripple’s case. On Monday, former SEC Office of Internet Enforcement Chief John Reed Stark said that the speed reversal of crypto enforcement actions could be a good thing for Ripple. “ So this is how the SEC dies. The rapid-fire demolition of the SEC’s crypto-enforcement program continues. SEC investigations of Uniswap & OpenSea officially closed. Dropping of the SEC’s Ripple appeal next up for sure, ” Stark stated. Other legal experts see Ripple pushing for a more favorable settlement, making them in no hurry to see the case end. Through a post on X, Attorney James Murphy speculated that Ripple could be negotiating to vacate Judge Torres’ ruling. “ The Torres decision was unquestionably GREAT for $XRP holders, BUT the finding of securities law violations and the injunction (with attendant ‘bad boy’ provisions) are not so great for Ripple. This is particularly true if Ripple is considering a future exempt securities offering or IPO, ” he wrote. Murphy also predicted the SEC might be willing to accept a settlement where both sides dismiss their appeals and Ripple pays the $125 million fine. Still, he noted that Ripple may be holding out for a better deal. Why? Because the digital asset company could be feeling hard done by facing the heat from regulators, while other organizations like the Ethereum Foundation, operated much more freely. Will Ripple’s connections to the Trump Administration be enough? Ripple has undoubtedly crawled its way to Washington, moving away from the allegations that they supported former Vice President Kamala Harris against President Trump. Ripple CEO Brad Garlinghouse has dinner with President Trump. Source/ X The company’s executives have actively sought favor with the new White House leadership, with CEO Brad Garlinghouse meeting Donald Trump at Mar-a-Lago on January 8. The company seems to be in good spirits with Trump, who is now back in office moving strings to add XRP into his proposed US crypto strategic stockpile. In a Truth Social post made on Sunday, he doubled down his support for digital assets. “ A U.S. Crypto Reserve will elevate this critical industry after years of corrupt attacks by the Biden Administration, which is why my Executive Order on Digital Assets directed the Presidential Working Group to move forward on a Crypto Strategic Reserve that includes XRP, SOL, and ADA. I will make sure the U.S. is the Crypto Capital of the World. We are MAKING AMERICA GREAT AGAIN! ” Trump wrote . The US President nominated former commissioner Paul Atkins to replace Gary Gensler as SEC Chair, and the general expectation is that he will bring regulatory clarity to the crypto industry at large. Some agency officials could be waiting for new leadership and what influence Trump will have on Atkins, before making a final decision on the case. The SEC might be rolling back its previous enforcement actions, but the mere fact that no action has been taken on matters Ripple, we don’t know when the financial regulator will let go of the lawsuit.

title: Urgent Crypto Relief: White House Advisor Champions IRS Broker Rule Rollback
body: Exciting news for the crypto community! A significant development is unfolding in Washington that could drastically alter the landscape of digital asset regulation in the US. White House Crypto and AI Advisor David Sacks has thrown his weight behind the movement to repeal the controversial IRS broker rule. This rule, which has sparked widespread debate and concern within the DeFi space, is now facing a crucial Senate vote. Let’s dive into what this means for you, the crypto enthusiast, investor, and builder. Why is the IRS Crypto Rule Causing Such a Stir? The proposed IRS crypto rule , often referred to as the ‘broker rule,’ mandates stringent reporting requirements for entities deemed as brokers in the digital asset ecosystem. While seemingly intended to enhance tax compliance, its broad definition of ‘broker’ has sent ripples of anxiety through the decentralized finance (DeFi) sector. Many argue that the rule’s ambiguity could inadvertently ensnare DeFi protocols, developers, and even individual users in a web of complex and potentially unworkable compliance obligations. Here’s a breakdown of the core concerns: Overly Broad Definition of ‘Broker’: The rule’s language is perceived as too vague, potentially classifying DeFi platforms, wallet providers, and other non-custodial entities as brokers, even though they may not have the necessary information or capabilities to comply with traditional broker reporting requirements. Impact on DeFi Innovation: The burdensome compliance demands could stifle innovation within the rapidly evolving DeFi space. Projects might be forced to relocate overseas or cease operations altogether to avoid regulatory hurdles. Privacy Concerns: Critics worry that the rule could lead to excessive data collection and erosion of user privacy within the crypto ecosystem. Technical Challenges: Implementing the reporting requirements for decentralized and often pseudonymous DeFi protocols presents significant technical challenges. David Sacks Crypto Stance: A Beacon of Hope? Enter David Sacks, the White House Crypto and AI Advisor, who, according to Eleanor Terrett’s report on X, has publicly endorsed the rollback of this contentious IRS crypto rule . Sacks’ support is a significant development, lending considerable weight to the repeal efforts. His position signals a potential shift in White House thinking towards a more balanced and innovation-friendly approach to crypto regulation. For many in the crypto community, Sacks’ backing represents a beacon of hope, suggesting that policymakers are beginning to understand the nuances and unique challenges of the digital asset space. Senate Vote: What’s at Stake for Crypto Tax Regulation? The Senate is poised to vote on the repeal of the IRS crypto rule this week. This vote is a pivotal moment for the future of crypto tax regulation in the United States. The outcome will have far-reaching consequences for the industry, influencing everything from DeFi development and adoption to investor sentiment and capital flows. A successful repeal would be widely celebrated by the crypto community, viewed as a victory for sensible regulation and a commitment to fostering innovation. Conversely, failure to repeal could solidify a regulatory framework perceived as overly restrictive and detrimental to the growth of the digital asset economy. Here’s what’s at stake: Outcome of Senate Vote Potential Impact on Crypto Industry Repeal of IRS Broker Rule Boost to DeFi innovation and growth Reduced compliance burden for crypto businesses Positive market sentiment and increased investment Greater clarity and certainty in crypto regulation Failure to Repeal Stifled DeFi innovation and potential exodus of projects Increased compliance costs and complexity Negative market sentiment and potential capital flight Regulatory uncertainty and chilling effect on crypto adoption Decoding DeFi Regulation: Navigating the Complexities The debate surrounding the IRS crypto rule underscores the broader challenges of DeFi regulation . Decentralized Finance, by its very nature, operates outside the traditional financial system, presenting unique regulatory hurdles. Policymakers are grappling with how to apply existing financial regulations to this novel technology while fostering innovation and protecting consumers. Finding the right balance is crucial. Key considerations for effective DeFi regulation include: Clarity and Specificity: Regulations must be clear, specific, and tailored to the unique characteristics of DeFi, avoiding overly broad or ambiguous language. Risk-Based Approach: Regulation should focus on mitigating genuine risks, such as illicit finance and consumer protection, without unnecessarily stifling innovation. Industry Collaboration: Regulators should engage in ongoing dialogue and collaboration with the crypto industry to understand the technology and develop practical, effective regulations. International Coordination: Given the global nature of crypto, international cooperation is essential to avoid regulatory arbitrage and ensure consistent standards. White House Crypto Policy: A Glimpse into the Future David Sacks’ stance on the IRS crypto rule offers a valuable insight into the evolving White House crypto policy . His support for repeal suggests a potential shift towards a more pragmatic and innovation-centric approach. This could signal a broader trend within the Biden administration to create a regulatory environment that fosters responsible crypto innovation while addressing legitimate concerns. The upcoming Senate vote will be a key indicator of the direction of US crypto policy and its commitment to remaining a leader in the digital asset revolution. Conclusion: A Pivotal Moment for Crypto The Senate vote on the IRS broker rule is more than just a procedural step; it’s a defining moment for the crypto industry in the United States. With White House Advisor David Sacks championing the repeal, the stage is set for a potentially transformative outcome. Whether the Senate votes to roll back this controversial rule remains to be seen, but one thing is clear: the future of crypto tax regulation and the trajectory of DeFi regulation are hanging in the balance. Stay tuned as we closely monitor this developing story and its implications for the exciting world of cryptocurrency. To learn more about the latest crypto regulation trends, explore our article on key developments shaping crypto policy and institutional adoption.

title: North Korean Hackers Convert 417,348 Ethereum Worth $1,000,000,000 Into Bitcoin Mostly via THORChain: Bybit CEO
body: The CEO of the recently hacked crypto exchange Bybit says that North Korean hackers have converted 417,348 stolen Ethereum ( ETH ) into Bitcoin ( BTC ). According to Bybit CEO Ben Zhou, North Korean state-sponsored hackers stole approximately $1.4 billion in ETH from Bybit, bridging a significant portion of the assets to Bitcoin. Says Zhou, “Total hacked funds of USD 1.4bn around 500k ETH, 77% are still traceable, 20% has gone dark, 3% have been frozen.” The Lazarus Group, a notorious North Korean hacking collective, cracked Bybit’s Ethereum wallets last month in what is believed to be the biggest heist in history. To turn the stolen ETH into BTC, Zhou says that they mostly used THORchain, a decentralized cross-chain liquidity protocol that allows for the exchange of assets between various chains, including Bitcoin, Ethereum and the BNB Chain. Zhou says the next two weeks will be critical for freezing the stolen funds at crypto exchanges. “- 83% (417,348 ETH, ~$1B) have been converted into BTC with 6,954 wallets (Average 1.71 btc each). This and the coming week is critical for fund freezing as the funds will start to clear at exchanges, otc and p2p. Hacker mostly used THORChain to clear ETH to BTC – 361,255 ETH or $0.9B, which is 72% was through Thor, which we can trace. – 79,655 ETH ~16% of the funds went dark through ExCH still waiting for update. – 40,233 ETH or $100M, which is 8% was through OKX web3 proxy. Out of them, 16,680 ETH we can trace 23,553 ETH or $65M (~5%) is untraceable which require info from OKX web3 wallet.” ByBit has launched lazarusbounty.com to track stolen funds and offer rewards for assistance in recovery efforts. title: Crypto Markets Bounce as Trump’s Tariffs Take Effect

title: XRP, SOL, and ADA Inclusion in US Crypto Reserve Pushes Traders on Edge
body: There has been growing uncertainty and frustration among cryptocurrency traders following Bitcoin’s steep 10% drop within 24 hours. The sudden decline sparked widespread panic and anger across crypto-focused social media channels and has prompted concerns about a potential repeat of the 2022 bear market, according to Santiment’s latest insight. However, optimism briefly resurfaced over the weekend after US President Donald Trump announced the creation of a US Crypto Strategic Reserve, which aims to strengthen the country’s digital finance. The reserve is part of an initiative stemming from an executive order signed in January 2025, which established a task force to develop national cryptocurrency regulations within six months. The market initially responded positively, with Bitcoin and other digital assets surging on expectations of institutional support and regulatory clarity. However, this optimism was short-lived, as a sharp reversal on Monday erased gains and reignited concerns about the initiative’s future. Fear and Frustration Dominate Crypto Social Media A key point of contention among investors is the selection process for assets included in the reserve, particularly the inclusion of XRP, SOL, and ADA. With little information on how the reserve will function, how it will be funded, or its integration into the broader financial system, speculation has dominated discourse. The lack of clarity has led to a mix of skepticism and humor across the crypto community as traders await further details. The upcoming White House Crypto Summit is expected to provide more insights, potentially shaping the regulatory framework for digital assets in the US. Until then, the announcement appears to have played out as a classic “buy the rumor, sell the news” event, Santiment noted . Adding to market volatility, Monday’s sell-off coincided with a significant downturn in traditional equities, as the S&P 500 recorded a 1.8% decline—one of the largest single-day drops in the past year. The correlation between crypto and traditional markets suggests that macroeconomic factors also influence price movements. The company further noted that social sentiment would likely dictate short-term price direction, with recent high-price mentions potentially signaling a market top. On the other hand, discussions of lower Bitcoin targets ($70K-$75K) could indicate a bottom forming as retail investors capitulate. Despite the current wave of “grief and frustration,” historical trends suggest that such extreme negativity often precedes market recoveries. Opportunity Amidst Chaos? A similar sentiment was echoed by CryptoQuant amidst turbulent market conditions, particularly in Bitcoin’s derivatives activity and investor sentiment. According to the report, the Open Interest Change (7D) plummeted by 14.42% on March 1st, which indicated a sharp decline in speculative positions. Such a decrease is often associated with market corrections, potential capitulation, or a reset in trader positioning, which can create buying opportunities during downturns. Meanwhile, the Crypto Fear & Greed Index has experienced a drastic shift as it dropped from 72 (extreme greed) on February 4th to 26 (fear), reflecting growing investor caution. Historically, extreme greed levels above 70 have signaled market tops, while fear-driven declines often precede rebounds as per CryptoQuant. The concerns over US government-held crypto reserves and upcoming regulatory discussions continue to impact the market. CryptoQuant’s analysis suggests that while sentiment remains fragile, the combination of declining open interest and fear-driven selling may present strategic entry points for long-term investors. The post XRP, SOL, and ADA Inclusion in US Crypto Reserve Pushes Traders on Edge appeared first on CryptoPotato .

title: Crypto Czar David Sacks Says He Sold All Bitcoin, Ethereum and Solana Prior to Trump’s Inauguration
body: The White House’s “Crypto Czar” David Sacks says he sold all of his crypto, including Bitcoin ( BTC ), Ethereum ( ETH ) and Solana ( SOL ), before the start of Donald Trump’s presidency. Sacks says he also owned a $74,000 position in a Bitwise exchange-traded fund, which he sold on January 22nd, two days after Trump’s inauguration. Sacks previously served as PayPal’s chief operating officer (COO) and is a high-profile venture capitalist who has invested in Airbnb, Palantir, Postmates, Reddit, Slack, SpaceX, Twitter, Uber and other big-name tech companies. He’s also sunk capital into crypto projects, including participating in a $10 million Series A round for the decentralized exchange (DEX) dYdX ( DYDX ) in 2018 via his growth fund Craft Ventures. The Financial Times, citing “a person with knowledge of the matter,” reports that Craft Ventures still holds stakes in “a small number” of crypto startups, though the firm also sold off its direct crypto holdings. Trump confirmed over the weekend that the US will establish a “crypto strategic reserve,” noting that it is primed to include Bitcoin, Ethereum, XRP , Solana and Cardano ( ADA ). Trump framed the reserve as a response to what he called “corrupt attacks” on the crypto industry by the Biden Administration, emphasizing his goal to make the US the “crypto capital of the world.” Don't Miss a Beat – Subscribe to get email alerts delivered directly to your inbox Check Price Action Follow us on X , Facebook and Telegram Surf The Daily Hodl Mix Disclaimer: Opinions expressed at The Daily Hodl are not investment advice. title: Mexican billionaire Ricardo Salinas allocates 70% of his portfolio to Bitcoin
body: Mexican billionaire Ricardo Salinas has revealed that he has allocated 70% of his investment portfolio to Bitcoin. He also added that he has allocated the remaining 30% of his portfolio to Gold. The entrepreneur, whose net worth is estimated to be roughly $5.8 billion, is a known Bitcoin proponent who on several occasions showed support for the digital asset. The Mexican billionaire disclosed in 2021 that he was working to make his bank the first in Mexico to accept BTC. Salinas allocates 70% of his investment portfolio to BTC Ricardo Salinas revealed in an interview with Bloomberg that he has allocated 70% of his investment portfolio in BTC. The outspoken billionaire also said that 30% of his investment portfolio was in gold and gold miners. Mexico’s third-richest individual said that he doesn’t possess stakes in bonds, and the only stocks he owned were those that belong to his group of companies. “I’ve got about 70% in Bitcoin-related exposure and 30% in gold and gold miners. I don’t have a single bond and I don’t have any other stocks except my own.” – Ricardo Salinas . He also highlighted that the 70% figure was notably far above the 10% he had allocated to the digital asset back in 2020. The CEO of TV Azteca, Mexico’s number two TV broadcaster, is also facing several tax cases with the Mexican government. The government has accused Salinas of owing over 63 billion pesos ($3 billion) in taxes, which has initiated court cases between both parties. Ricardo Salinas Photographer: Eva Marie Uzcategui/Bloomberg The Mexican businessman denied the allegations by the government and argued that there might be an error. He maintained that the computation of his alleged back taxes was due to an accounting error that resulted in his double billing. The billionaire is now contesting the penalties that he accrued while the case is ongoing. Salinas acknowledged that he was willing to pay his dues, but he would not pay them twice. Salinas plans to delist Grupo Elektra The Mexican entrepreneur also revealed that he plans to delist Grupo Elektra, his flagship company. He highlighted that the move came after years of fighting to defend the share price of the flagship and a months-long trading halt in 2024. Salinas also argued that the delisting would enable him to run his company as he sees fit and without any public pressure. Elektra noted that the move was aimed to reorganize and strengthen the company’s extensive and diverse assets and “to find tools to maximize its real value.” He also revealed that he’ll get the delisting done by around May, in part because only 0.3% of shares remain outstanding. The company was widely covered by analysts in the wake of Salinas’ 2012 battle with Mexico’s stock exchange. At the time, the exchange wanted to remove the firm’s stock from the benchmark IPC index due to allegations that the company was manipulating the amount of floating shares in the market. The firm won a court order to guarantee its position, which locked in sustained flows from exchange-traded funds. Elektra’s stock price surged over the following years, reaching an all-time high of 1,631 pesos in June of 2021. At the time, the firm was the country’s most expensive by far even though trading volumes were a fraction of other companies. Luciano Pascoe, the head of Salinas’ news network ADN 40 and a spokesman for Grupo Salinas, said that the decision to exit the Mexican stock market was a “very brave decision.” He also argued that speculation had been putting the firm below its real value for a long time and that was why it left the stock market. Pascoe believes that the company was in a more solid position for a more prosperous future. The Mexican businessman posted a video on his personal blog where he avoided directly addressing the delisting and thanked his employees for a “great year.” He said that despite a complicated environment and despite the thousands of problems that always exist, “we move ahead.” Cryptopolitan Academy: Coming Soon - A New Way to Earn Passive Income with DeFi in 2025. Learn More

title: XRP and Ethereum Experience a New Decline – Is It Just a Temporary Dip or Another Round of Panic?
body: XRP and Ethereum prices have recently taken a hit, sparking curiosity among investors about whether this downturn is temporary or indicative of deeper market challenges. President Donald Trump’s initiation of a global trade war—with steep tariffs on imports from Mexico, Canada, and China—has sent shockwaves through global markets. As these policies led to billions wiped out overnight and unprecedented market volatility, even digital assets like Ethereum have felt the impact, dropping significantly from their previous highs. The ensuing chaos has heightened concerns over risk assets, with crypto markets losing billions in market cap in just 24 hours. This turbulence raises critical questions about whether current setbacks for cryptocurrencies like XRP and Ethereum are short-lived corrections or the start of a broader trend. In this article, we delve into the current market trends, examining the effects of geopolitical pressures on crypto prices and exploring whether these digital currencies might stage a comeback. Discover which digital coins could be primed for growth, offering potential opportunities amidst the global economic storm. Ripple XRP: Volatility and a 6-Month Surge XRP experienced a 19% decline over the last month, reflecting a period of volatility. In contrast, the asset has enjoyed a dramatic 316% increase over the past six months, showcasing significant long-term strength. A slight recovery of 1.7% in the last week indicates a potential for short-term positioning within a market that has displayed considerable price swings. The established range between $1.60 and $2.88 highlights both the risk and opportunity that XRP presents for investors. Currently, trading is focused within a defined range, with key resistance levels at $3.61 and a stronger ceiling at $4.89. Support is identified near $1.06, where bears are currently applying some pressure. Technical indicators reflect slight negative momentum, highlighted by an RSI reading of 45.53, suggesting the absence of a strong bullish trend. Traders may look to the $3.61 level for potential breakout opportunities or may consider accumulating shares around the $1.06 support level as the market seeks clarity. Ethereum Price Analysis Amid Bearish Pressure Ethereum prices dropped by 32.65% over the past month and fell 14.43% over the last six months. The decline reflects steady weakening that has kept traders alert for shifts in momentum. Price fluctuations during this period underscored market uncertainty and emphasized the need for cautious strategies as momentum indicators turned negative, while the overall trend remained lower. The current price range lies between $1766 and $3020, with a key support level at $1294 and resistance around $3804. Bearish signals dominate with a momentum indicator of -667.82, an RSI near 33.30, and overall negative recommendations, suggesting a lack of a clear upward trend. Traders might consider short-term positions within these levels, watching for potential breakdowns below support or failed attempts to breach resistance. Conclusion XRP and ETH are going through a tough time. The market dip could be a short-term issue or a sign of deeper trouble. Investors should keep an eye on market trends and news. Both coins have shown resilience in the past. This phase could be a buying opportunity or a signal to wait and watch. The next few weeks will be crucial in determining the direction of these assets. title: Turnaround Tuesday Sees Crypto and Stocks Bounce Sharply From Worst Levels
body: A big Tuesday reversal in risk markets has seen bitcoin (BTC) climb nearly 10% from its weakest level of the session and the Nasdaq move into the green after being lower by nearly 2% earlier in the day. Buffeted about by Trump's tariff threats for weeks, stocks and crypto initially were sharply lower today as the levies against Mexico, Canada and China actually went into effect. Dip-buyers emerged late in the U.S. morning, though, and with a bit more than an hour to go before the close of stock trading, the Nasdaq is sporting a 0.7% advance on the session. The S&P 500 has narrowed a large early loss to just 0.25%. Trading just above $88,000, bitcoin is now ahead 1.5% over the past 24 hours. Ether (ETH) continues to underperform, flat over that time frame at $2,171. Tuesday's action continues a wild 10-day ride for bitcoin, which plunged more than 20% in about a six-day period from Feb. 21 to just above $78,000, only to rebound more than 20% to about $95,000 over the following three days before tumbling anew yesterday and this morning to the $81,000 level. A check of crypto-related stocks today finds Strategy (MSTR) ahead 11%, Coinbase (COIN) up 4% and Marathon Holdings (MARA) with a 5% gain. Green shoots? It's been a difficult few weeks for risk assets, but the downturn may also be creating the conditions for an eventual rebound. It wasn't long ago when markets had all but written off the chance for any Federal Reserve rate cuts in 2025 and the 10-year Treasury yield was threatening to rise above 5%. The tariffs, though, have combined with some weakish economic data and the tumble in markets to change that calculus . Interest rate traders have now fully priced in three or more Fed rate cuts this year, with the first move coming as soon as May. The 10-year Treasury yield, in turn, has pulled back to 4.15% from 4.80% at the time of the Trump inauguration six weeks ago.

title: Bitcoin ‘Won’t Stop At $150K’ This Year, Research Firm Chief Says
body: A well-known market analyst believes Bitcoin is on track to reach new highs this year. Tom Lee, the co-founder of Fundstrat Global Advisors, expects the cryptocurrency to do “better than $150,000” by the end of 2025. Related Reading: BTC Repeats Historic Pattern—Is a Breakout Toward $100K Next? His latest comments come as Bitcoin struggles with recent volatility but remains a popular investment choice among institutional and retail traders. The co-founder of Fundstrat expressed his opinions on CNBC’s Squawk Box, referencing a variety of favorable fundamentals for the price of Bitcoin. Bitcoin Volatility And Market Movements In recent months, the top coin has had a lot of ups and downs. In February 2025, the top cryptocurrency saw a nearly 24% decline, which caused some investors to lose faith. In spite of this, the current price of Bitcoin is nearly $84,500. During the day, it fluctuated between a high of $90,400 and a low of $82,500. Lee, nevertheless, is unconcerned with the fluctuations and thinks that BTC’s long-term prospects surpass its short-term declines. JUST IN: Expect Bitcoin go higher than $150,000 this year, says Fundstrat’s Tom Lee pic.twitter.com/z0mGAPe16b — Bitcoin Archive (@BTC_Archive) March 3, 2025 Institutional Support And Broader Adoption Growing participation of significant financial actors is one of the main causes of Lee’s confidence. Companies like Citadel have entered the crypto space to give Bitcoin more legitimacy. The alpha coin’s use case gets stronger for future expansion the more conventional institutions interact with digital assets. “I think Bitcoin makes a beeline back towards its long-term trend line, which is probably $82,000 in the near term, $150,000 before year-end,” says @fundstrat‘s Tom Lee as $BTC closes in on its all-time high. pic.twitter.com/g4p6VOTECx — Last Call (@LastCallCNBC) March 5, 2024 Other financial behemoths also show great optimism for Bitcoin. Both Bitwise and Standard Chartered project Bitcoin to reach $200,000 in 2025. Such forecasts support Lee’s point of view and confirm that Bitcoin still has lots of space to expand. Government Influence On Bitcoin’s Future Regulatory decisions could also play a role in Bitcoin’s performance this year. United States President Donald Trump recently declared his intention to establish a strategic cryptocurrency reserve. This action suggests that the government is becoming more interested in digital assets, which could affect market sentiment and raise prices. At the same time, regulatory uncertainty still influences changes in the price of Bitcoin. Even if institutional usage is growing, market observers will closely monitor any changes to regulations that may have an impact on the future of cryptocurrencies. Related Reading: Bitcoin’s Risk Factor Remains High, Crypto Analyst Notes Long-Term Holding Vs. Short-Term Trading Lee tells people who want to invest in Bitcoin to think about the long run. He says that there are often short, unpredictable bursts of growth for the coin. He says it’s dangerous to try to time the market. Instead, it might be smarter to hold on to Bitcoin for a long time. Bitcoin’s price isn’t stable at all, but buyers are still interested in it because it has a history of strong recovery. If Lee is right, 2025 could be another big year for the biggest coin in the world. Featured image from Getty Images, chart from TradingView
